newsitem.title: USA: Acclaim to release 16 software titles.
newsitem.headline: Acclaim to release 16 software titles.

text.p: Acclaim Entertainment Inc said on Tuesday it expected to release 16 new software titles in the second quarter of fiscal 1997.
The company reported a first quarter loss of $19 million, or $0.38 a share, against earnings of $595,000, or $0.01 a share, in the same period of fiscal 1996.
In a statement, Acclaim said it released 24 new products in the first quarter, including WWF: In Your House and NBA Jam Extreme for Sony PlayStation and Sega Saturn.

"In 1997's second fiscal quarter, the company plans to release 16 titles, including Magic: The Gathering - BattleMage for the PC, which began shipping last week; Psychic Force, the hit coin-op conversion created by Taito; and Turok: Dinosaur Hunter, an original title developed by Acclaim's Iguana Entertainment for the Nintendo 64, which the company intends to release at retail on "Turok Tuesday" in March," the statement said.
